intro: Spiraea japonica f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower Japanese spirea, is a compact shrub native to Japan. It features showy, flat-topped clusters of white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has slender, arching branches and small, oval leaves that are glossy green throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and long-lasting blooms.
